A new study shows @RockyNPS is one of many national parks suffering from climate change, & that the methane being released by oil and gas sites is largely to blame. This is a prime example of why the bill I filed to #CutMethane is more important than ever. https://gazette.com/government/rocky-mountain-among-of-national-parks-suffering-because-of-pollution/article_f52a7c50-70fd-11e9-9f47-8b86df020adf.html …

Methane is up to 80 times more potent than CO2 and one of the leading contributors to global warming. Obama put rules in place to stop methane leaks from U.S. drilling sites. Trump undid those rules. My bill would reinstate them, protect them and make them stronger. pic.twitter.com/jEf3nvfEGJ

If we’re going to fix this climate crisis, we have to cut the amount of methane released into our atmosphere. 1/3 of all leaked methane comes from oil & gas drilling sites. Today, I introduced a bill requiring drillers to capture this gas, instead of letting it leak into our air. pic.twitter.com/A6JpBUxlyB

Colorado's $28 billion outdoor recreation industry is dependent on access to our public lands. Our bill would permanently protect an additional 740,000 acres as wilderness. #ColoradoWildernessAct

Colorado’s treasured landscapes are what make our state so unique.
